page.title: 02 GEOGRAPHY OF FOLKESTONE
page.content: Folkestone is sited on the Kent coast at the foot of the North Downs. Settlement on this site can be traced back to the Bronze Age, but by Tudor times the town had a population of only 500, many of whom were seamen. The arrival of the railway during the 19th century saw Folkestone develop as a resort; this is one of its functions today, along with being a cross-Channel port, a business, conference and inter- national festival centre, and a retire- ment town. The growth of Folkestone during the second half of the 20th century has extended over virtually all of the flat area at the foot of the Downs,with residential and light industrial estates being the predominant land uses. The latter are well served by the M20 motorway, an artery vital to the continued prosperity of the town.
